place.name: COLN ROGERS
place.gazetteerText: COLN-ROGERS, a parish in Northleach district, Gloucester; on the river Colne, 4 miles SSW of Northleach, and 7 NE by N of Cirencester r. station. Post town, Northleach, under Cheltenham. Acres, 1, 508. Real property, £1, 502. Pop., 116. Houses, 28. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Gloucester and Bristol. Value, £225.* Patrons, the Dean and Chapter of Gloucester. The church is old but good. Charities, £6. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
